ERS Rurality codes

Download and combine data

Rural-Urban Continuum Codes

Homepage

download_and_combine_ruc[source]

download_and_combine_ruc()

Download Rural-Urban Continuum codes and documentation. Combine all years of data into single CSV file. Save all documentation into single TXT file.

Urban Influence Codes

Homepage

download_and_combine_ui[source]

download_and_combine_ui()

Download Urban Influence codes and documentation. Combine all years of data into single CSV file. Save all documentation into single TXT file.

download_and_combine_ruca()

Download Rural-Urban Commuting Area codes and documentation. Combine all years of data into single CSV file. Save all documentation into single TXT file.

download_and_combine_all()

Download and prepare RUC, UI and RUCA code datasets.

get_ruc_df[source]

get_ruc_df()

Return pandas.DataFrame of Rural-Urban Continuum codes for all years.

get_ui_df[source]

get_ui_df()

Return pandas.DataFrame of Urban Influence codes for all years.

get_ruca_df[source]

get_ruca_df()

Return pandas.DataFrame of Rural-Urban Commuting Area codes for all years.

Descriptive summary

Simple visualization of the data.

Rural-Urban Continuum Codes

Documentation notes that not all years are directly comparable.

In 1974, 1983 and 1993 there was code "0", join it with "1" for simplicity.

#collapse
df = get_ruc_df()
df['RUC_CODE'] = df['RUC_CODE'].replace('0', '1')
df['POPULATION'] = df.groupby('FIPS')['POPULATION'].fillna(method='bfill')

stats = df.groupby(['RUC_YEAR', 'RUC_CODE'])['POPULATION'].agg(['size', 'sum'])
stats['sum'] /= 1000
stats.columns = ['Counties', 'Population']
stats = stats.astype(int).unstack()

# 2003 and 2013 codes are identical
codes = (df.loc[df['RUC_YEAR'] == 2013, ['RUC_CODE', 'RUC_CODE_DESCRIPTION']]
         .dropna().drop_duplicates()
         .sort_values('RUC_CODE')
         .reset_index(drop=True))

pd.options.display.max_colwidth = 200
codes
RUC_CODE RUC_CODE_DESCRIPTION
0 1 Metro - Counties in metro areas of 1 million population or more
1 2 Metro - Counties in metro areas of 250,000 to 1 million population
2 3 Metro - Counties in metro areas of fewer than 250,000 population
3 4 Nonmetro - Urban population of 20,000 or more, adjacent to a metro area
4 5 Nonmetro - Urban population of 20,000 or more, not adjacent to a metro area
5 6 Nonmetro - Urban population of 2,500 to 19,999, adjacent to a metro area
6 7 Nonmetro - Urban population of 2,500 to 19,999, not adjacent to a metro area
7 8 Nonmetro - Completely rural or less than 2,500 urban population, adjacent to a metro area
8 9 Nonmetro - Completely rural or less than 2,500 urban population, not adjacent to a metro area

Number of counties 

#collapse
data = stats['Counties']
data
RUC_CODE 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
RUC_YEAR
1974 186 269 192 173 155 565 736 241 624
1983 238 294 203 140 154 559 763 229 561
1993 311 320 205 138 114 615 656 248 534
2003 455 336 367 221 105 614 451 235 436
2013 472 395 369 217 92 597 434 220 425 
#collapse
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 4))
idx = [str(x) for x in data.index]
bottom = pd.Series([0] * len(data), index=data.index)
for code in data:
    ax.bar(idx, data[code], bottom=bottom, label=code)
    bottom += data[code]

dummy = mpl.patches.Patch(fill=False, edgecolor='none')
handles, labels = ax.get_legend_handles_labels()
handles = [dummy] + handles[:3] + [dummy] + handles[3:6] + [dummy] + handles[6:]
labels = ['metro'] + labels[:3] + ['nonmetro'] + labels[3:6] + [''] + labels[6:]
ax.legend(handles, labels, ncol=3, loc='upper center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.1))

ax.set_title('Number of counties by Rural-Urban Continuum code')

plt.show()

Population

No population in dataset before 2010, so 2010 is used for earlier years.

#collapse
data = stats['Population']
data
RUC_CODE 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
RUC_YEAR
1974 109749 67842 26498 18375 11220 18943 17192 3635 5709
1983 126151 63773 25965 12275 9991 17192 16442 3111 4260
1993 138147 62392 22468 10501 7144 18062 13766 2892 3788
2003 151788 56091 28373 14546 5573 15209 8472 2425 2804
2013 170874 66299 28845 13633 4953 14837 8257 2157 2611 
#collapse
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(6, 4))
idx = [str(x) for x in data.index]
bottom = pd.Series([0] * len(data), index=data.index)
for code in data:
    ax.bar(idx, data[code], bottom=bottom, label=code)
    bottom += data[code]

dummy = mpl.patches.Patch(fill=False, edgecolor='none')
handles, labels = ax.get_legend_handles_labels()
handles = [dummy] + handles[:3] + [dummy] + handles[3:6] + [dummy] + handles[6:]
labels = ['metro'] + labels[:3] + ['nonmetro'] + labels[3:6] + [''] + labels[6:]
ax.legend(handles, labels, ncol=3, loc='upper center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.1))

ax.set_title('Population in thousands by Rural-Urban Continuum code')

plt.show()
